content:
Hey, so we had discussed maybe discussing some RFC procedure-like issues in our next meeting. Here are some thoughts:

  • we could talk about the pre-RFC idea, and maybe some @T-lang members want to attend too

• we could about how to manage RFC discussion, e.g. some of the topics we touched on in rust-lang/wg-governance#38 -- I'd love it if @Josh Triplett were able to attend too, as he's had some thoughts on this from experiences around inline asm, and perhaps @simulacrum too as he expressed an interest in tooling in this area
I'd be pretty interested, in particular, in trying to have some new ways to have RFC conversations, and to make them "opt-in" to some extent
I've updated agenda . . . I originally thought pre-RFC would be a topic.

Since our meeting is this week we should probably decide on the topic. It seems like most of the interest is in the RFC conversations so let's try to do that.

cc @Josh Triplett & @simulacrum Would either of you be able to attend at 18:00 CET to discuss that topic on Zulip this Thursday? The meeting is an hour long but you don't have to stay for the whole thing if you can't make it.
agenda is up to date re RFC conversations
